nav.div: Natick Public Schools » News » Current » 2020 COVID-19 Information & Updates » Food Resources

p.style: margin-bottom: 0px; padding: 10px 0px; color: rgb(89, 89, 88); font-family: "Merriweather Sans", sans-serif; font-size: 12px; letter-spacing: normal;
p.span: We know school closures may significantly impact families in different ways, especially those experiencing food scarcity and insecurity. We want to ensure our students are able to continue receiving daily meals, while schools are closed.

p.style: margin-bottom: 0px; padding: 10px 0px; color: rgb(89, 89, 88); font-family: "Merriweather Sans", sans-serif; font-size: 12px; letter-spacing: normal;
p.span: Starting on Monday, March 16th, Grab ‘n Go meals will be available to NPS students in need. Please see pickup details below:

p.style: margin-bottom: 0px; padding: 10px 0px; color: rgb(89, 89, 88); font-family: "Merriweather Sans", sans-serif; font-size: 12px; letter-spacing: normal;
margin-bottom: 0px; padding: 10px 0px; color: rgb(89, 89, 88); font-family: "Merriweather Sans", sans-serif; font-size: 12px; letter-spacing: normal;
p.span: Location: Natick High School, Rear Bus Loop (behind the building)

p.style: margin-bottom: 0px; padding: 10px 0px; color: rgb(89, 89, 88); font-family: "Merriweather Sans", sans-serif; font-size: 12px; letter-spacing: normal;

strong.hr: Below are also sharing information about about City of Boston and other food resources available.

p.style: margin-bottom: 0px; padding: 10px 0px; color: rgb(89, 89, 88); font-family: "Merriweather Sans", sans-serif; font-size: 12px; letter-spacing: normal;
p.span: Boston resident students will be able to access the city’s food resources:

a.style: font-family: Arial; font-size: 12pt; background-color: white; cursor: pointer; color: black;

p.style: margin-bottom: 0px; padding: 10px 0px; color: rgb(89, 89, 88); font-family: "Merriweather Sans", sans-serif; font-size: 12px; letter-spacing: normal;
p.span: Project Bread: They will be able to support families in need, especially if you are unable to go to work. Call: (1-800-645-8333)
